introduction: Chapter 15 of the evaluation inspection analytics and models course focuses on inspection methods for developing alternatives to usability testing in the early 1990s. The methods introduced in this lesson are based on understanding a user through knowledge, flexibility, and efficiency of use accelerators. The chapter covers various inspection methods, including heuristic evaluation, walkthroughs, aesthetic and minimalist design, help user, meaningful labels, minimize unnecessary complexity and cognitive goal, provide the user with context, reduce short-term memory loads, and simulating the user problem-solving process. The chapter also discusses the role of analytics in evaluation and provides an overview of the number of page views per day using remote controls. Additionally, the chapter introduces Pette's Law, a technique used to predict user performance and compare different design up layouts for virtual or physical objects. The chapter is aimed at evaluators who need to modify the metal core evaluation with the market since speed loss was originally developed. The video covers a variety of topics, including algorithms and data structures, artificial intelligence and machine learning, computer architecture, data science and analytics, human-computer interaction, programming languages and software development, software engineering and system design, web development and internet technologies, computer graphics and visualization, theoretical computer science, and quantum computing.
